entry.title: Breakdown Maintenance End to End Process
entry.content:
BREAKDOWN MAINTENANCE: -

                           In SAP S/4 HANA EAM the breakdown maintenance business process is a type of maintenance activity that will take place or be carried out in response to unexpected failure or breakdowns of equipment. In SAP S/4 HANA EAM breakdown maintenance will be carried out through the creation and execution of maintenance orders and maintenance notifications. In breakdown maintenance you correct a malfunction of equipment by raising the notification in the system. And then the work order will be performed by technician at the equipment and respective authorized person will approve the work order.

                              But the response to the breakdown maintenance should be very rapid because production will stop and due to this the manufacturing of finished material will be stopped and it will be a huge loss for any company.

Work process of breakdown maintenance: -

  1. Identification of breakdown: - here the notification will be created.
  2. Evaluation & Planning: - here evaluation of equipment, review the notification, based on the review they will assign priority, work order creation and also assign the work center or technician for the order.
  3. Execution of breakdown maintenance: -here execution of work order takes place, and the materials or spare parts will be procured from the inventory, equipment will be isolated, and it will be shutdown.
  4.  Documentation and data capture: - here the documentation and confirmation of work order takes place.
  5. Inspection and testing: - inspection and trail of equipment will be done after maintenance.
  6. Completion and reporting: - TECO ‚Äì technical completion will be takes place in this step.
  7. Continuous improvement: - analysis of data will take place and the company will come up with improvements that need to be made.

STEP 1: -   CREATTION OF NOTIFICATION

We will create a notification through IW21 but here the notification type will be M2. Here M2 is being used because since it is malfunction of an equipment.

Here we will just enter the details of the functional location and equipment in the notification. We will provide the details to tell the technician that in particular location a equipment is present, and it needs to be repaired.
Functional location --> represents the location and equipment --> represents the machine

Here the details of the functional location and equipment will be provided and then after the technician will save the notification. If the equipment already has already existing notifications or else orders, then the object information key will display it in the format as shown below if it is being activated in the configuration path.

The production supervisor will inspect the equipment and then he will add the object parts that need to be inspected, and the damaged parts will be entered in the notification by navigating to the change mode of the notification.

   STEP2: - ADDING OF TASKS TO THE NOTIFICATION

Here after adding the tasks, we can be able to see the items and tasks in the next tabs of the notification. The tasks are being added because it indicated parts that might be damaged.

After entering all the details of object parts and damage in the notification the notification will be released or put in process by clicking on the green flag symbol which is present in the notification

Also, the production supervisor will put in the tasks that are needed to be performed by the technician who is coming for maintenance purposes that he has to perform the maintenance activates that what he needs to perform on the machine.

Here the tasks will also be released from the notification.

STEP 3: -   CREATION OF ORDER BASED ON NOTIFICATION
Here the production supervisor will create a maintenance order through IW34 based on notification and the details will be picked up from the notification itself. And also, here since it is breakdown so the indicator will be checked.

The estimated costs will be given by the maintenance team based upon the requirement of the material and the person resources. 
Here the operational hours to do the maintenance will be added to the operations and the no.of people or manpower that is being required to perform the maintenance is being calculated here. The work center will be given here and the activity type will be picked up from the work center. For the activity type the cost calculation is done in the transaction code KP26 which will be done by FICO team.

In components tab what are the materials that are needed to perform the maintenance are being entered. Here in item category L - Stock item is maintained since there is stock in the inventory. 

After entering the components and the operational hours we will directly put them in the process because it is breakdown. Since we are putting it in a direct process a printout will be taken and then right after the work starts.

STEP 3: - MIGO - Goods Issue Against Order. (Material Management people are responsible for this step)
Here the goods will be issued by the material management by using the t-code MIGO.
A prerequisite that the order needs to be released or else posting goods against the order cannot be done. 
Here just check the movement type whether it is 261- goods issue against the order or not.

STEP 4: -    CONFIRMATION OF ORDER
Here the goods will be posted towards the technician against the order and the technician will perform the maintenance order and then the confirmation will be done and here we will just check the checkboxes like final confirmations, clear reservations, no remaining work.
Final confirmation --> it means the technician have performed his work and no more confirmation can be done for that                                                         operation.
Clear Reservations --> it means if there is any reservation that is done against the order for material it will be cleared.
No remaining work --> the technician has completely done his work, and no more work is pending if the work is still pending then the checkbox will not be checked, and the field remaining work will be entered. 

STEP 5: -    TECO --> TECHNICAL CONFIRMATION
Here after performing the confirmation, the technical confirmation will be done in the order header level as well as in the notification level too by clicking on the confirmation of tasks in the tasks tab in the notification. For order by clicking on the race flag which is present in the order.

After performing TECO for the notification then we will perform TECO for order.

STEP 6: -   SETTLEMENT OF ORDER
After completion of the order the FICO team will do the settlement against the order in KO88.

Accounting document: - Below is the accounting documents for the order.

Controlling document: - Below is the controlling documents against the order.

After performing the settlement by fico team, we will just navigate tot the t-code IW32 which is change mode of the order and here we will just click on the complete business.


Here you can observe the status as close in the system status.

FLOW CHART: -

The flow chart of breakdown maintenance 




The above describes the process of handling breakdown maintenance. Feel free to provide any comments or suggestions.

Regards,
Neeraj.

entry.title: Use the Public API to Maintain Availability data for Workforce Person from Excel
entry.content:
‚ö†Ô∏èDisclaimer: The script in this blog is provided as a reference to accelerate the bulk upload of availability data. This is not an official SAP product. For uploading availability data through resource management, refer to SAP documentation.

Overview

Recently, I worked on a requirement where we needed to upload workforce availability data into SAP Resource Management. After the workforce person replication was completed from the SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) service, I explored ways to efficiently maintain and update availability using Microsoft Excel and SAP‚Äôs public Workforce Availability API.

While SAP offers tools like the Maintain Availability Data app and Workforce Availability API, I wanted to simplify the process for non-technical users. So, I automated the upload process via Excel macros (VBA) ‚Äî allowing anyone to upload workforce availability data without needing to write any code or use external tools like Postman or curl.

Here‚Äôs a breakdown of how I approached it, along with key steps and learnings.

Current Ways to Maintain Availability Data of a Workforce Person:  

Now, SAP gives you a couple of options:

  • Use the Maintain Availability Data app

  • Or use the Workforce Availability API.

We will use Microsoft Excel and the public API to upload the availability data of workforce person.

Requirements:

  • A Windows operating system
  • Microsoft Excel
  • This process will be working with the custom domain migration. For more information refer Custom Domain Documentation.

Setup/Configuration:

Follow the below steps to set the Excel ready to upload the availability data.

If the Developer tab is not enabled in Excel, follow the below steps. If it is already installed, skip this step.

Enable the Developer Ribbon in Excel
  1. Click on the File tab.
  2. Select Options.
  3. Click Customize Ribbon.
  4. Under Main Tabs, check the Developer checkbox.
  5. Click OK.

Once enabled, the Developer ribbon will be visible in the header section in the Excel.

Step1: Download the CSV Template

  1. Login to Resource Management and navigate to the Maintain Availability Data app.

  2. Download the required CSV template for the selected workforce person.
  3. Open the downloaded CSV file using Microsoft Excel.
Step 2: Import Files into VBA
  1. Click on the Developer ribbon.
  2. Select Visual Basic to open the VBA Editor.
  3. Download the files added in the Github URL  into a folder in your local System.
  4. In the left-hand panel, under VBAProject (Microsoft Excel Objects), right-click and select Import File.
  5. Import the provided .bas file.
  6. Repeat the same process to import the .frm file.
  7. After importing, the project structure will update with added modules and forms.

Step 3: Run the Macro Script
  1. Under the Modules folder in the VBA Project, locate the imported module file.
  2. Click on the file and select Run from the header.
  3. A pop-up confirmation will appear. Click Run.
Step 4: Provide Required Information
4.1 Starting API URL Format:
https://{host}.{domain}.{environment}/WorkforceAvailabilityService/v1
  • The host and environment are constant; the user only needs to provide the domain.
  • Domain options:
    • eu10 ‚Üí eu10 datacenter 
    • us10 ‚Üí us10 datacenter
    • eu11 ‚Üí eu11 datacenter
4.2 Authentication Details
4.2.1 Creating a Service Key 

You should follow the steps mentioned here to create the service key to the access the public API.

  1. Open your Global Account in SAP BTP Cockpit.
  2. Open your Subaccount.
  3. In the navigation area, select Spaces and open the required space.
  4. Navigate to Services > Instances & Subscriptions.
  5. Locate the service instance for which you need to create the service key.
  6. Click on Actions (‚ãÆ) and select Create Service Key.
  7. In the New Service Key dialog :
    • Enter a name for the service key.
    • If using client credential authentication, no further input is needed.
4.2.2 Viewing Credentials
  1. Once the service key is created, select View Credentials.
  2. A JSON file is displayed containing the following key attributes:

Attribute Description

uaa.clientidThe OAuth client ID.
uaa.clientsecretThe OAuth client secret.
uaa.urlThe base URL for the OAuth server.
apiUrlThe base URL for resource management APIs.

These details can be used for authentication in API requests.

  1. Enter the values in the form that appears when running the script.
  2. Edit the authentication URL for the OAuth server by appending /oauth/token.

Note: "Image/data in the screenshots is from SAP internal systems, sample data, or demo systems. Any resemblance to real data is purely coincidental."

Step 5: Submit the Data
  1. After entering all necessary information, click Submit.
  2. A confirmation MsgBox will appear. Click OK.
  3. The API response will be recorded in the file:
    • If successful, the message "200 Availability Created" will appear.
    • If failed, the error response will be recorded in the corresponding row for review.
  4. For real-time execution logs, open the VBA macro script and press CTRL+G. A lower window will display API requests and responses.
Step 6: Save the Excel File
  • Once all availability data has been processed, save the file as an Excel Macro-Enabled Workbook (.xlsm) for future use.

 

Further information and resources

  • WorkforceAvailability API in SAP Business API Hub: https://api.sap.com/api/WorkforceAvailability/resource
  • Set up API access: https://help.sap.com/docs/PPRM_OD/a2ad92d065e04e8393d72cace620e0be/24b5d0bbc0c442a5a8d258f7c17cd393....
  • API documentation: Workforce Availability

entry.title: Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Release ‚Äì What‚Äôs New
entry.content:
The new 2508 release has just been made available and of course we would like to share with you the innovations delivered for Warehouse Management. You can find a comprehensive overview in the What‚Äôs New presentation. 

But let me already give you an overview on some of the release highlights within this blog. Let‚Äôs get started!

 

Core Function 

Enablement of Additional End-to-End Processes 

Following our Suite-First strategy, we consider it essential that Warehouse Management works with all scope items and process variations that are available within SAP ‚Äì and as you might know, that is quite a lot. Therefore, I am happy to share that with this release we were able to release the enablement of six (!) additional end-to-end processes: 

  • Stock transfer with delivery (BME) in combination with transportation management 
  • Intercompany stock transfer returns (2TS) 
  • Intracompany stock transfer returns 
  • Customer returns for sales kits (5CX) 
  • In-house repair (3XK) - Send back to customer 
  • Just-in-time supply to customer (2EM) - Summarized JIT calls 

For all of these, the respective delivery can now be distributed to and processed in Warehouse Management. The selection of the delivery via the according reference documents is enabled, e.g. to select an outbound delivery based on the JIT reference. You‚Äôll find more details on each of these in the linked What‚Äôs New presentation. 

Stock Removal Strategy for Direct Goods Movement Postings

In my view, this innovation is quite special, because it is different from the classical paradigm to always go via warehouse tasks when removing stock. Some customers asked for a very simplified way of posting the consumption for the components of their production orders. Instead of using one of the production integration patterns where you first stage the components to the production supply area and then post the consumption from there, the staging and consumption is done in just one step. This is achieved, by posting the consumption directly from the storage bin in the warehouse. The operator is then responsible to physically remove it from there and hand it over to production, but from a system perspective the stock is already consumed. To simplify this process, we have introduced a new button in the app ‚ÄúPost Goods Movement‚Äù, to run the stock determination and to thereby propose the storage bin from which the consumption can be posted.

Combined Picking in RF 

This feature has already been very popular in Private Cloud EWM and has now been asked for by many of our Public Cloud customers. The scenario is to have multiple outbound deliveries, all requesting the same product. A typical scenario would be e-commerce where many different end customers have ordered one piece of a certain product. Since a picking warehouse task is always created per outbound delivery order item, this would mean in this scenario, that multiple picking warehouse tasks are created, all requesting one piece of the same product from the same storage bin. Obviously, confirming those in RF on the mobile handheld device one-by-one is quite cumbersome for the warehouse operative and very inefficient. With this innovation, those quantities are now combined, summed up and displayed as just one pick in RF, while in the background, it is still individual warehouse tasks. To prevent a day-one impact, this feature must be activated in the configuration. 

Migration Object: Assign Storage Bin to Production Supply Area   

Even though this innovation is ‚Äújust‚Äù a migration object, I am convinced that it is very important to many customers. When working with the Advanced Production Integration, it is mandatory to maintain the assignment of storage bins to the production supply area, including the staging behaviour for individual products. As some of our customers have thousands of products to be maintained here, it is essential that this maintenance can be simplified with a migration object.

Compare Stock with Inventory Management 

When using Warehouse Management, the stock is managed in the warehouse on individual storage bins, but the stock is also still managed in Inventory Management on storage location level. Warehouse Management is then the leading system in terms of stock management. All stock postings are done in Warehouse Management, but they always update Inventory Management. Therefore, the stock balance in Warehouse Management and Inventory Management is always in sync. In rare cases it can happen that deviations occur, for example because of rounding issues. Worst case, this can then lead to an error when trying to update Inventory Management from Warehouse Management. Therefore, we have released a new app to compare the stock in Warehouse Management with Inventory Management. If there are any differences, then this app allows to immediately correct these differences with an additional stock posting, correcting the stock in Inventory Management. 

 

Extensibility 

New CDS Views 

Same as with the last releases, we have again shipped additional CDS views, allowing customers to access the data they need to build their extensions. 

There is a new CDS view to access the storage bin data, thereby making one of the most central objects available. In addition, there are new CDS views available in the area of wave management, providing access to wave headers and wave items but also to settings such as wave templates and wave types. 

 

Integration 

Additions to the Warehouse Order and Task API 

With the Warehouse Order and Task API being one of the most central APIs in Warehouse Management, it has received some additions in this release: 

  • Merging multiple warehouse orders into one warehouse order 
  • Splitting warehouse tasks from an existing warehouse order 
  • A new parameter to prevent the full handling unit withdrawal during the confirmation of product warehouse tasks 

Additions to the Storage Bin API 

The Storage Bin API had been a read-only API so far but has now been enhanced with the following: 

  • Create storage bins 
  • Update storage bins 
  • Action to block storage bins 
  • Action to unblock storage bins 

 

FIND OUT MORE! 

This blog only pointed out some of the highlights of this release ‚Äì you can find the full list of innovations in the What‚Äôs New presentation.
